description: Transform raw data into understandable reports and dashboards to help businesses make informed decisions, identify trends, and measure performance.
certifications: Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate

Beginner: Learn Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP)
Learn basic SQL for querying databases
Understand basic statistics (mean, median, distribution)
Intermediate: Master a visualization tool (Power BI/Tableau)
Learn Python basics and Pandas for data manipulation
Complete a full project: data cleaning, analysis, visualization
Advanced: Learn advanced SQL (window functions, CTEs)
Understand version control (Git)
Develop domain expertise (e.g., Finance, Healthcare)

description: Design, build, and deploy production-ready machine learning systems and models that can scale to handle real-world data.

Beginner: Master Python and key libraries (NumPy, Pandas)
Learn core math concepts (Linear Algebra, Calculus, Stats)
Complete an Intro to ML course (e.g., Andrew Ng)
Intermediate: Build ML models with Scikit-learn
Learn Deep Learning with TensorFlow/PyTorch
Work on end-to-end projects (data to deployed model)
Advanced: Learn MLOps tools (Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow)
Master cloud platforms for ML (SageMaker, Vertex AI)
Study advanced topics like NLP or Computer Vision

resources.title: Coursera: Machine Learning by Andrew Ng

description: Extract insights and build predictive models from complex data using advanced statistical and machine learning techniques, often focused on R&D.
certifications: None are strictly required (portfolio is key)
IBM Data Science Professional Certificate (for beginners)

Beginner: Learn Python for Data Science (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib)
Solidify understanding of Probability & Inferential Statistics
Learn to tell stories with data
Intermediate: Master machine learning theory and application
Learn advanced SQL and database interaction
Develop strong business acumen to frame problems
Advanced: Design and analyze A/B tests
Explore Big Data tools (Spark, Hadoop)
Publish findings or build a strong portfolio of complex projects

description: Design, construct, and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure (data pipelines, warehouses, lakes) that enables data analysis and science.
prerequisites: Proficiency in a JVM Language (Java/Scala) is a plus

Beginner: Master SQL and database fundamentals
Learn Python and its ecosystem
Understand data modeling and warehousing concepts
Intermediate: Learn a Big Data processing framework (Apache Spark)
Master a cloud platform (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Learn workflow orchestration (Apache Airflow, Prefect)
Advanced: Build scalable, fault-tolerant data pipelines
Deep dive into stream processing (Kafka, Flink)
Specialize in a domain like FinTech or AdTech

description: Specialize in building the visible, interactive parts of a website or application that users interact with directly.

Beginner: Learn core web technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Build simple static websites
Learn Git and GitHub
Intermediate: Master a modern framework (React is most popular)
Learn state management, APIs, and routing
Focus on responsive design and accessibility (a11y)
Advanced: Learn testing (Jest, Cypress)
Optimize for web performance and SEO
Explore full-stack basics and TypeScript

description: Build and maintain the server-side logic, databases, and APIs that power the frontend of web and mobile applications.
prerequisites: Strong understanding of a programming language
Basic knowledge of how the internet works (HTTP, protocols)

Beginner: Master a backend language (e.g., Python, Java, Node.js)
Learn about RESTful API design principles
Understand relational databases and SQL
Intermediate: Learn a web framework (e.g., Django, Spring Boot, Express.js)
Explore authentication and authorization (OAuth, JWT)
Work with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis)
Advanced: Master system design and architecture patterns
Learn about containers and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes)
Implement monitoring, logging, and testing strategies

description: Bridge the gap between development and IT operations by automating and streamlining software delivery and infrastructure changes.

Beginner: Master Linux fundamentals and Bash scripting
Learn a programming language (Python/Go)
Understand networking and security basics
Intermediate: Learn core DevOps tools: Git, CI/CD, Docker
Master a cloud provider (AWS is a great start)
Learn Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or CloudFormation)
Advanced: Master container orchestration (Kubernetes)
Implement advanced monitoring and logging (Prometheus, ELK)
Design and manage highly available and secure systems

description: Design, plan, and manage an organization's cloud computing strategy, including infrastructure, services, and deployment.

Beginner: Learn cloud fundamentals and core services (Compute, Storage, Networking)
Get an entry-level cloud certification (e.g., AWS Cloud Practitioner)
Learn basic Linux administration and networking
Intermediate: Master a primary cloud platform in-depth
Learn Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
Understand cloud security and compliance best practices
Advanced: Get a professional/architect-level certification
Design highly available, cost-effective, and scalable cloud infrastructures
Specialize in a domain like security, networking, or data

description: Protect an organization's computer systems and networks by monitoring, detecting, investigating, and responding to security threats.

Beginner: Learn networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, OSI model)
Understand core security principles and threats
Get CompTIA Security+ certified
Intermediate: Gain hands-on experience with SIEM tools (Splunk, Elastic)
Learn about incident response and digital forensics
Practice in controlled environments (TryHackMe, HackTheBox)
Advanced: Specialize in a area like penetration testing, cloud security, or forensics
Obtain advanced certifications (CISSP, CySA+)
Lead threat hunting and security architecture initiatives

description: Create user-centered designs by understanding user needs, designing the user journey (UX), and crafting the visual style and interface (UI).

Beginner: Learn design principles (typography, color, layout)
Master a design tool (Figma is industry standard)
Understand the basics of user research
Intermediate: Build a portfolio with case studies (show your process)
Learn to create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups
Conduct usability tests and iterate on designs
Advanced: Specialize in a area like interaction design, research, or UX writing
Learn about accessibility (a11y) guidelines
Work closely with product managers and developers
